Key Match Events: Cleveland Cavaliers ended Oklahoma City's 15-game winning streak
Donovan Mitchell had a subpar game with 11 points on 3 of 16 shooting
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 31 points for the Thunder
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game had the intensity of a Finals matchup in June
There were 30 lead changes and neither team led by more than nine
Others: Cleveland improved their league's best record to 32-4
The Cavs moved to 19-1 at home
Isaiah Hartenstein finished with 18 points, 11 rebounds and eight assists for the Thunder
